title: Jinx's Rocket Ride; or I'm making a video game!

embed.description: TinyUpload.com - solution for tiny file hosting. No download limits, no upload limit. Totaly free.

body:
Inspired by a post elsewhere in this forum*, I'm making a little League of Legends-themed Java game. I've only got the bare bones done and it has no art assets yet, but if anyone wants to have a look at what I'm doing you can download it from the link above.

*( http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-creations/VH9NGWyx-idea-for-april-fools )

The controls in this version are simple: move the mouse around to steer, press the mouse button to increase the difficulty. To restart the game you have to close the program and start it again, but that is one of the things that I will be implementing as development progresses.

replies.body:
I have uploaded a new version of the game, which can be found here:

http://s000.tinyupload.com/index.php?file_id=82403953347891177916

Progress continues. I'm having a hard time composing some good music for the game, so for the moment it's just got some basic drums. Do that and finish the assets for the fireworks, and I'll post the new version this weekend, just in time for April Fools' Day.
More progress on the art assets, as you can see here:

I've done Jinx now as well. Here's the vector art that will be reposed and scaled down for the various sprites.

http://fav.me/d8itfs3

Work continues on the game. I've made the rocket and done perhaps half the work on Jinx herself. At the moment I'm thinking I'm going to use a 128 pixel character model rather than the original 64.

The forum doesn't accept gifs as attachments, but you can see one of the three rocket sprites at this DA link:

http://fav.me/d8imu79

Riot's legal page explicitly allows projects such as this one. As long as I don't put the game behind a paywall without their written permission (donations or ad revenue appear to be fine), I'm in the clear.

Even if that was not the case, I'm not using any of their art assets and I am not infringing upon their trademark by falsely implying that this game is produced by Riot, so the only area of contention would be my use of Jinx's likeness in the game - a problem that could be solved by replacing a few sprites.

You'd be better off posting a screenshot or video to begin with, at least, I'd be suspicious of running someone's code like this. If someone downloads this, be sure to run it through a virus scanner. Not to diss you or anything, I'm sure the file's perfectly innocent.
Fair enough. I'm only using placeholders for the art assets at this stage so it is understandably rubbish-looking, but here's a screenshot.

The game so far is only 340 lines of code. Writing 340 lines of code is faster than drawing a dozen pictures, so the game part of the game is being made faster than the sprites for the game. Since there needs to be something there to see if the game is actually working, I have these scribbles as stand-ins for each of the sprites that will be in the final game.
